pull.title: build: Add `show-%` target for multi-line variables and debug info
pull.body:
This PR is a continuation of bitcoin/bitcoin#17087.

Our depends builds system uses a bunch of variables which values consist of some lines, i.e., multi-line variables.

During debugging it is annoying that `print-%` is unable to handle such variables:
```
$ cd depends
$ make print-sqlite_set_vars
/bin/sh: 1: Syntax error: Unterminated quoted string
make: *** [Makefile:5: print-sqlite_set_vars] Error 2
```

This PR adds `show-%` target which prints multi-line variable value and its origin and flavor as well:
```
$ cd depends
$ make show-sqlite_set_vars
- name:   sqlite_set_vars
- origin: file
- flavor: simple
- value, printed from the new line:
sqlite_config_opts=--disable-shared --disable-readline --disable-dynamic-extensions --enable-option-checking
sqlite_config_opts_linux=--with-pic
sqlite_config_opts_freebsd=--with-pic
sqlite_config_opts_netbsd=--with-pic
sqlite_config_opts_openbsd=--with-pic
```

For connoisseurs suggesting `make show-qt_set_vars` :)

---

Other useful examples of usage:
```
$ make show-CC
- name:   CC
- origin: default
- flavor: recursive
- value, printed from the new line:
cc
```

```
$ make show-CC CC=clang
- name:   CC
- origin: command line
- flavor: recursive
- value, printed from the new line:
clang
```

```
$ CC=clang make show-CC
- name:   CC
- origin: environment
- flavor: recursive
- value, printed from the new line:
clang
```

```
$ make show-host
- name:   host
- origin: file
- flavor: simple
- value, printed from the new line:
x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
```

---

Please note that it is unwanted to just modify the `print-%` rule as it is used in [scripts](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5034b7fa3b97c1cbaf93b337d462777f3e25d256/contrib/guix/guix-build#L130).

events.body: Concept ACK. I think this kind of debugging functionality is very useful, especially for complex makefiles such as those used in the depends system.

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25964](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25964) (build: fix mingw miniupnpc cflags by fanquake)
* [#21778](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21778) (build: LLVM 14 & LLD based macOS toolchain by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

rename.from: build: Add print-all-% target for multi-line variables and debug info
rename.to: build: Add `show-%` target for multi-line variables and debug info

events.body:
@laanwj 
> Any reason for keeping this in draft status?

The wrong output here:
```
$ make show-sqlite_set_vars
- name:   sqlite_set_vars
- origin: file
- flavor: recursive
- value, printed from the new line:
zeromq_config_opts=--disable-shared --disable-readline --disable-dynamic-extensions --enable-option-checking
zeromq_config_opts_linux=--with-pic
zeromq_config_opts_freebsd=--with-pic
zeromq_config_opts_netbsd=--with-pic
zeromq_config_opts_openbsd=--with-pic
```

> Any reason for keeping this in draft status?

Ready for reviewing now.

@laanwj 

Thank you for your reminding.
The PR description has been updated.

Rebased 2d290d8a4a2fe3d620bfbaf5c3b719401288a87b -> 6c18d85889ebdd70241d69023d2dade8a2270efc ([pr24283.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr24283.04) -> [pr24283.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr24283.05)) due to the conflict with #25697.

verification.payload:
tree 830bcd1ffbf976d89884ed8c84825b675d8ec0f6
parent f765d4e232a57255dc13585f88bd8eb450da50c0
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1650133828 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1659604428 +0100

scripted-diff: Make `$(package)_set_vars` simply expanded variables

This change guarantees that variable values are correct at any time.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
s() { sed --in-place --expression="s/$1$/$2/g" $(git grep --files-with-matches "$1" "$3"); }
s 'define $(package)_set_vars' 'define $(package)_set_vars :=' './depends'
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.message:
scripted-diff: Make `$(package)_set_vars` simply expanded variables

This change guarantees that variable values are correct at any time.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
s() { sed --in-place --expression="s/$1$/$2/g" $(git grep --files-with-matches "$1" "$3"); }
s 'define $(package)_set_vars' 'define $(package)_set_vars :=' './depends'
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.body: Rebased 6c18d85889ebdd70241d69023d2dade8a2270efc -> 9d568cceca18c00100a3ed9bd735477553501426 ([pr24283.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr24283.05) -> [pr24283.06](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr24283.06)) due to the conflict with #25633.
Are you still working on this?

> Are you still working on this?

I am. However, closing due to the lack of interest from other developers.

comments.body: Maybe a dumb question, but what does the added `:=` do?
It makes `$(package)_set_vars` a [simply expanded variable](https://www.gnu.org/software/make/manual/html_node/Flavors.html) which value is defined just after parsing.
